docs.lead_paragraph: Mitt Romney said that under his plan, those with existing conditions would be guaranteed access to health insurance, but that would apply only to patients who maintained continuous coverage.

headline.seo: Romney’s Pledge Shows Repealing Health Law to be Complex
headline.main: It Will Be Tricky for Romney to Keep Best of Health Law While Repealing It
headline.print_headline: It Will Be Tricky for Romney to Keep Best of Health Law While Repealing It

docs.abstract: Mitt Romney's pledge to guarantee access to health insurance for people with longstanding medical problems confuses some experts, and highlights the difficulty he would face in attempting to repeal the new health care law while keeping some of its most popular features.
docs.snippet: Mitt Romney said that under his plan, those with existing conditions would be guaranteed access to health insurance, but that would apply only to patients who maintained continuous coverage.

docs.lead_paragraph: A new report by the Institute of Medicine explains how hundreds of billions of dollars is spent on unnecessary services and other needless costs.

headline.seo: Waste in the Health Care System
headline.main: Waste in the Health Care System
headline.print_headline: Waste in the Health Care System

docs.abstract: Editorial cites Institute of Medicine report that estimates roughly 30 percent of health care spending in 2009, around $750 billion, was wasted on unnecessary or poorly delivered services and costs; holds report makes clear that pilot projects in Affordable Care Act to encourage better coordination of care, make medical prices transparent and accelerate the use of health information technology should be expanded.
docs.snippet: A new report by the Institute of Medicine explains how hundreds of billions of dollars is spent on unnecessary services and other needless costs.

headline.seo: Door to Door in Oklahoma City, Preaching Healthy Living
headline.main: Door to Door in the Heartland, Preaching Healthy Living
headline.print_headline: Door to Door in the Heartland, Preaching Healthy Living

docs.abstract: Local governments across the country are using money allocated by the Affordable Care Act to create programs that help curb the incidence of obesity and other diseases and promote healthy lifestyles; trend is part of a national effort set in motion by the law to move from a reactionary health care system to one based on prevention.
docs.snippet: With money allocated by the Obama health care law, local governments are creating programs to help curb the incidence of obesity and other diseases and promote healthy lifestyles.

docs.lead_paragraph: The share of young adults without health insurance fell by one-sixth in 2011 from the previous year, according to the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention.

headline.seo: More Young Adults Have Health Insurance, Study Says
headline.main: More Young Adults Have Insurance After Health Care Law, Study Says
headline.print_headline: More Young Adults Have Insurance After Health Care Law, Study Says

docs.abstract: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention study finds share of young adults without health insurance fell by one-sixth in 2011 from the previous year, largest annual decline for any age group since the CDC began collecting data in 1997; study attributes the increased coverage to a provision in the Affordable Care Act that allows children to stay on their parents' insurance policies until their 26th birthday.
docs.snippet: The share of young adults without health insurance fell by one-sixth in 2011 from the previous year, according to the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention.

docs.lead_paragraph: Mitt Romney has pledged to cut individual income tax rates for everyone, but he has provided few specifics, confounding analysts and leaving himself open to attack from Democrats.

headline.seo: Romney’s Tax Plan Leaves Key Variables Blank - Washington Memo
headline.main: Romney’s Tax Plan Leaves Key Variables Blank
headline.print_headline: Effects of Romney’s Tax Plan? Key Variables Are Left Blank

docs.abstract: Washington Memo; Mitt Romney has pledged to cut individual income tax rates for everyone, and to do it without increasing the federal budget deficit or putting new tax burdens on middle-income people to make up for the lost revenues; candidate has provided no further specifics of plan, confounding analysts and leaving himself open to attack from Democrats.
docs.snippet: Mitt Romney has pledged to cut individual income tax rates for everyone, but he has provided few specifics, confounding analysts and leaving himself open to attack from Democrats.
